title: Category creation and brand building | Barbra Gago (Pando, Miro, Greenhouse, Culture Amp)
key_insights: Category creation requires significant investment in content marketing, thought leadership, and analyst relationships - only pursue when existing categories are too small or constraining
When creating categories, you need both budget validation and customer language alignment - if customers consistently use different terms, abandon the new category
Successful rebranding should happen early in scale mode, before too much brand equity is built, and must involve the entire company in a structured process
Brand systems should integrate company values into visual elements and behaviors, making the brand inseparable from company culture
Opinionated software works best when either codifying existing best practices or solving systematic problems that require behavioral change
Category creation often happens in waves during technological inflection points rather than as isolated company decisions
The middle ground between new and existing categories can work - sell into existing budgets while building long-term category vision
topics_discussed: Visual collaboration category creation at Miro
Failed recruiting optimization category at Greenhouse
Brand system design and company values integration
Category creation vs existing category optimization
Market inflection points and category waves
memorable_quotes: When you're building a category, you need to make sure that there is a category that's validated by analysts and directory sites and things like that. But also, you want to have a lot of traction in terms of thought leadership
It's not officially actually a category until there's more companies that do that. And that was a big learning for me in this whole process of category creation
The product and the brand are the main things that will get customers and keep them and also keep them loyal and engaged. So I think you have to have both
frameworks_mentioned: Category validation through analysts and directories
Voice of customer research for positioning
recommended_for: B2B SaaS executives developing go-to-market strategy
summary: Barbra Gago shares tactical insights from creating the visual collaboration category at Miro and leading major rebrands, covering when to create new categories versus compete in existing ones, plus practical frameworks for brand building and opinionated software design. The episode provides actionable guidance for B2B marketing leaders navigating positioning, branding, and go-to-market decisions.
